title: Jallikattu ban: Over 200 people detained, massive protests in Tamil Nadu
title_page: Jallikattu ban: Over 200 people detained, massive protests in Tamil Nadu - NewsX
text:
Chennai: Hundreds of people in Tamil Nadu took to the streets on Tuesday after more than 200 people demonstrating in favour of Jallikattu were detained by police in Madurai.
DMK working president MK Stalin, condemned the arrests and lamented the current AIADMK rule in Tamil Nadu as “draconian”. He demanded the immediate release of those taken into custody.
Also read: Why is Jallikattu issue so controversial
The police had housed the protesters, both men and women, in nearby wedding halls. People from various parts of the state had gathered in Madurai demanding passing of an ordinance to allow the sport.
“People have been kept in preventive custody. They had assembled unlawfully, despite several warnings,” said the police.
Earlier on Monday, people had kept the shops closed and hoisted black flags on their homes as a protest mark against the ban.
Jallikattu has found a strong political backing as well where, Tamil Nadu CM O Panneerselvam and later AIADMK general secretary VK Sasikala wrote to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asking him to pass an ordinance to allow the sport during this year’s Pongal season.
Superstar Rajinikanth on Friday extended his support for Jallikattu , saying the sport must be held as it is part of Tamil culture. “Bring in whatever rules but Jallikattu must be held to keep up the traditions of our Tamil culture,” said the ‘Kabali’ actor.
The apex court in May 2014 banned Jallikattu in Tamil Nadu. Ever since the order, massive protests have taken place with people demanding the central government to uplift the ban on the sport.
